subhead: Since the beginning of the year, more than 20,000 men, women and children have managed to reach the United Kingdom – 7,000 more than during the same period in 2024. At least 15 people have died while attempting the crossing.

subhead: A giant fair in downtown Washington, a mixed martial arts competition at the White House and a monument honoring national heroes: The American president plans to give the celebrations a resolutely patriotic tone, glossing over the darker chapters of the country's history.
byline: By Corine Lesnes (San Francisco (United States) correspondent)

title: Frontex unlawfully shared thousands of people's personal data with European police
subhead: In the name of combating migrant smugglers, the European Union's border surveillance agency spent years collecting information on migrants and civil society activists deemed 'suspect,' before passing it on to Europol, the EU police cooperation agency.
byline: By Apostolis Fotiadis, Lola Hierro and Ludek Stavinoha

title: The Swiss should drink more wine, says minister
subhead: While the government dutifully promotes public health, the minister of the economy and agriculture is expressing concern over the struggles of the country's wine industry.

title: From Rafah to Paris, Fadel Afana's journey as a psychiatrist in exile
subhead: A witness to the deterioration of mental health among the inhabitants of the Gaza Strip since 2008, the Palestinian practitioner arrived in Paris in October 2024. Thanks to the PAUSE program, he now works as part of a team of researchers from INSERM.

Tax on ultra-rich: 'France has the opportunity to lead the way,' say Nobel Prize-winning economists
subhead: As public deficits balloon and extreme wealth explode, creating a minimum tax on the assets of billionaires should be a priority, argue seven Nobel Prize-winning economists in an op-ed for Le Monde.

title: The Oder Bridge between Germany and Poland: The decline of a European symbol
subhead: After Berlin reinstated border checks to block migrants at the bridge in Frankfurt an der Oder, Warsaw responded with similar measures, disrupting daily life for locals. Once emblematic of the European Union's eastward expansion, the site now bears witness to the rise of xenophobic sentiment.
byline: By Elsa Conesa (Frankfurt an der Oder (Germany), Slubice (Poland), special correspondent)

title: Musk breaks with Trump and launches America Party, hoping to attract US voters frustrated by polarization
subhead: The billionaire, who was the main financial backer of the American president's campaign, has entered politics by striking at a sensitive chord: that of voters' expressed fatigue at the division of American political life into two irreconcilable camps.
